channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: RSAF to have fewer flights during national examinations to address noise concerns
item.description:
September 01, 2020 7:16 PM

SINGAPORE - The Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF) will implement flying restrictions during national examinations in response to noise concerns, several MPs announced in Facebook posts.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on Sept 1
item.description:
September 01, 2020 6:40 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Tuesday, Sept 1.

item.title: Singaporean youth who threw mug at maid, breaking her nose, gets reformative training
item.description:
September 01, 2020 6:33 PM

SINGAPORE - A youth who flung a metal mug at his family's domestic helper, fracturing her nose, was sentenced on Tuesday (Sept 1) to at least six months' reformative training.

item.title: $20 million fund for construction companies to offset costs of thermal scanners, AI cameras
item.description:
September 01, 2020 6:26 PM

SINGAPORE - Local construction companies can access a new $20 million fund to offset the cost of adopting advanced digital solutions to help keep work sites safe.

item.title: Singtel launches 5G trial services in Singapore, second telco after StarHub to do so
item.description:
September 01, 2020 4:35 PM

SINGAPORE - Singtel launched 5G trial services in Singapore on Tuesday (Sept 1), the second telco after StarHub to allow consumers to surf on a faster mobile network.

item.title: Financial services platform GoBear lays off 22 staff, including 6 in Singapore
item.description:
September 01, 2020 4:24 PM

SINGAPORE - Financial services platform GoBear has laid off six employees from its Singapore office, as well as 16 other workers from outlets in Vietnam, the Philippines and Ukraine owing to the impact of the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore, Brunei launch green lane for essential travel, applications open from Sept 1
item.description:
September 01, 2020 3:47 PM

Travellers are required to observe some restrictions including controlled itineraries and a negative Covid-19 test prior to the trip.

item.title: 40 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 1 in community and 7 imported
item.description:
September 01, 2020 3:40 PM

The Ministry of Health said there was one community case, a work pass holder, and seven imported cases.

item.title: Bedok double murder: Maid who killed elderly couple found guilty in Indonesian court
item.description:
September 01, 2020 2:55 PM

Khasanah will spend 20 years in jail for killing Mr Chia Ngim Fong, 79, and his wife Madam Chin Sek Fah, 78.

item.title: Remote ez-link card top-up with upgraded cards for 2,000 commuters in LTA pilot programme
item.description:
September 01, 2020 1:00 PM

The upgraded ez-link cards can be topped up using an ez-link app.

item.title: Coronavirus: 62,000 workers yet to be scheduled for routine testing ahead of Sept 5 deadline
item.description:
September 01, 2020 12:44 PM

More than 1,000 workers have had their approval to resume work rescinded after failing to go for routine testing.

item.title: Ex-primary school teacher pleads guilty to repeatedly abusing stepson
item.description:
September 01, 2020 11:52 AM

SINGAPORE - A former primary school teacher physically abused her young stepson multiple times between 2016 and 2018, causing injuries such as cuts to his scalp that required stitches after she struck him with a ceramic mug.

item.title: Over 13,000 training places with higher subsidies for workers in hard-hit aerospace sector
item.description:
September 01, 2020 10:30 AM

Workers who go for the training will have their pay during the training period, as well as their course fees, subsidised by up to 90 per cent.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Sept 1
Data firm hired to study pro-social safe spaces for online discussions
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The study could provide a blueprint for how potentially divisive conversations can be conducted and managed.

item.title: 27 months' jail for woman who cheated elderly friend
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

In need of cash, an avid gambler convinced her friend to withdraw his entire Central Provident Fund (CPF) savings of more than $53,000 in 1999 and hand over at least $500 of his salary every month from 2000 to 2013.

item.title: Shapes of Home photo contest: Capture snapshots of HDB life to win cameras, cash
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

What does your home mean to you? Show us through photos and stand to win prizes.

item.title: Singaporeans should not let guard down against coronavirus: Experts
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

As the authorities investigate whether safe distancing rules were breached leading to a family cluster of Covid-19 cases, experts warned that people should not let their guard down against the virus as Singapore continues to reopen.

item.title: PM Lee to take witness stand in Oct defamation trial against blogger
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will take the stand when his defamation trial against financial adviser and blogger Leong Sze Hian opens in the High Court next month.

item.title: Family Covid-19 cluster: At least one patient was active in community while symptomatic
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The grim reality is that things can get better slowly and can also get worse very quickly, said an expert.

item.title: Centre for urgent medical care opens in Kampung Admiralty
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

From today, residents living in the north will be able to seek urgent medical attention at a new facility within the community.

item.title: SGH can turn wards, ICUs into isolation rooms within hours
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore General Hospital (SGH) has created portable systems that can convert wards, intensive care units (ICU) and operating theatres into negative pressure isolation rooms within hours to house patients with infectious diseases.

item.title: Acquittal of 2 men in child trafficking case upheld
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The High Court yesterday upheld the acquittal of two men, who were jointly tried last year for receiving payment in connection with the sexual exploitation of a male child victim of human trafficking.

item.title: Coronavirus: 90 staff, residents at nursing home tested
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 90 staff and residents of a nursing home were tested for Covid-19 after a former employee who went back to the Philippines became infected.

item.title: 6 S'poreans joining virtual ultramarathon to help raise funds
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A group of six people will be running the distance from Johor Baru to Kuala Lumpur this weekend, except that the running will take place at East Coast Parkway.

item.title: Bar and two eateries ordered to close for flouting Covid-19 rules
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The operators of three food establishments have been ordered to close their premises by the Singapore Food Agency (SFA) for flouting safe management measures.

item.title: 157 hauled up in week-long anti-crime crackdown
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

In a week-long blitz, a total of 157 people were detained for various crimes, from illegal bookmaking to e-commerce offences.

item.title: Weakening duct supports a possible cause, say experts
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The dislodging of a ventilation duct from the ceiling of a cinema hall at Nex shopping mall on Sunday was possibly a result of weakening duct supports, such as loose nuts and bolts or spalling concrete slabs, said industrial experts here.

item.title: Singapore eyes closer tie-ups with Guangdong in finance, talent, aviation
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore aims to deepen collaboration with China's Guangdong province in several key areas, including financial services, talent exchange and aviation.

item.title: Patron says he thought crumbling noise was sound effect
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

More details and photos have emerged from the incident of a falling ventilation duct in a cinema hall at Nex mall that saw two women taken to hospital for their injuries.

item.title: Singapore, US reaffirm strong defence relations
item.description:
September 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen and US Defence Secretary Mark Esper held a videoconference yesterday in which they reaffirmed both countries' commitment to their excellent and longstanding defence relationship and mutually beneficial partnership.
